parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From a comparative of cheir and teino; to be a hand-reacher or voter, i.e. to select or appoint.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
Fasting, the day of atonement. From nesteuo; abstinence; specially, the fast of the Day of Atonement.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and tithemi; to place alongside, i.e. Present; by implication, to deposit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
